Class BouncingBall

java.lang.Object
  BouncingBall

public class BouncingBall
extends java.lang.Object

Class BouncingBall - a physical ball object with a graphical representation. The ball itself determines how it moves in response to external forces: -gravity -air resistance -surface resistance -ball hysteresis Movement is made by repeated calls to the move() method.

Version:
1 (19/10/2010) Based on a simple implementation of a Ball object written by Bruce Quig, Michael Kolling (mik) and David J. Barnes, for the book 'Objects First with Java - A practical Introduction Using BlueJ' (23-Jan-2002).
Author:
Robin Smith

          Constructor for BouncingBall object.
 
Method Summary
 void draw(java.awt.Color colour)
          Draw this ball at its current position onto the canvas.
 void erase()
          Erase this ball at its current position.
 Canvas getCanvas()
           
 void move(double delta_t)
          Erase this ball at its current position, then move it according to its new speed determined by the external forces acting on it in time interval delta_t.

Constructor Detail

BouncingBall

public BouncingBall(double xPos,
                    double yPos,
                    double xSpeed,
                    double ySpeed,
                    int diameter,
                    double ballHysteresis,
                    double gravity,
                    double airRes,
                    double surfaceRes,
                    Canvas canvas,
                    int[] platformPos,
                    DataAnalyser dataAnalyser)
Constructor for BouncingBall object.

Parameters:
xPos - initial horizontal position of the ball
yPos - initial vertical position of the ball
xSpeed - initial horizontal speed of the ball
ySpeed - initial vertical speed of the ball
diameter - diameter of the ball
ballHysteresis - amount of ball hysteresis on bouncing
gravity - strength of gravity in simulation environment
airRes - strength of air resistance
surfaceRes - strength of surface rolling friction
canvas - canvas to be drawn on
platformPos - array of platform heights as a function of x-position
dataAnalyser - DataAnalyser object to send data to
Method Detail

getCanvas

public Canvas getCanvas()
Returns:
the canvas on which this ball is drawn

Draw this ball at its current position onto the canvas.

erase

public void erase()
Erase this ball at its current position.

move

public void move(double delta_t)
Erase this ball at its current position, then move it according to its new speed determined by the external forces acting on it in time interval delta_t.
